lead: Robotics continues to be a pivotal area of technological advancement, with significant developments in funding, corporate strategies, and global competition.

stories.title: 23 Ways You’re Already Living in the Chinese Century
stories.summary: The article explores various aspects of modern life influenced by China's rapid advancements, particularly in robotics. It highlights how China has outpaced the U.S. in several technological sectors, including robotics, showcasing a future where these innovations could redefine global standards. The implications for the U.S. and the global economy are profound, as robotics becomes a central pillar of competition.

stories.title: ASUS will not release any new smartphones this year
stories.summary: ASUS is pivoting away from smartphones, with Chairman Jonney Shih hinting at a future focus on AI and robotics. This shift indicates a broader trend in the tech industry where companies are increasingly investing in robotics and AI technologies. While ASUS's current smartphones will still receive updates, the company's future may lie in developing innovative robotics solutions.

stories.title: Europe’s €307 million AI funding call
stories.summary: The European Commission has launched a €307 million funding initiative aimed at advancing AI and robotics, among other technologies. This strategic funding is part of a broader effort to enhance Europe's digital autonomy and promote trustworthy AI. While the amount may seem modest compared to private sector investments, it signifies a commitment to fostering innovation in robotics and related fields.

stories.title: Elon Musk’s stubborn spin on Grok’s sexualized images controversy
stories.summary: Elon Musk has been vocal about the role of AI and robotics in revitalizing the tech landscape, particularly at events like CES. The discussion around his AI tool, Grok, highlights the ongoing challenges and ethical considerations in the integration of AI and robotics into society. As tech billionaires navigate regulatory changes, the future of robotics remains a critical area of focus.
